titleStmt.title: Bridge Phase 2: Witness fMS, Collation unit C27

availability.licence: Distributed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License

body.ab: <lb n="c57-0117__main__1"/><milestone spanTo="#c57-0117.02" unit="tei:head"/>Chap. 14<shi rend="underline"></shi><lb n="c57-0117__main__2"/><lb n="c57-0117__left_margin__1"/> I was soon <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0117__main__d3e21785"/>int<del eID="c57-0117__main__d3e21785"/> introduced into the presence of the <lb n="c57-0117__main__3"/> Magistrate; an<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0117__main__d3e21790"/>d<del eID="c57-0117__main__d3e21790"/> old benevolent man with <lb n="c57-0117__main__4"/> calm & mild manners. He looked <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0117__main__d3e21798"/>towards<del eID="c57-0117__main__d3e21798"/>upon me <lb n="c57-0117__main__5"/> however with some degree of severity, and then <lb n="c57-0117__main__6"/> turning towards my conductors <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0117__main__d3e21809"/>wh<del eID="c57-0117__main__d3e21809"/> he <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0117__main__d3e21812"/>h<del eID="c57-0117__main__d3e21812"/> asked who <lb n="c57-0117__main__7"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0117__main__d3e21821"/>it was that<del eID="c57-0117__main__d3e21821"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0117__main__d3e21824"/>there were who<del eID="c57-0117__main__d3e21824"/> appeared as wit<lb n="c57-0117__main__8"/>nesses on this occasion<mdel>,</mdel>. about half a dozen <lb n="c57-0117__main__9"/> men came forward and one being selected <lb n="c57-0117__main__10"/> by the magistrate he deposed that he had been <lb n="c57-0117__main__11"/> out fishing the night before with his son &<lb n="c57-0117__main__12"/> his brother-in-law, Daniel Nugent, when <lb n="c57-0117__main__13"/> about nine o clock they observed a strong <lb n="c57-0117__main__14"/> northerly blast rising & they accordingly put <lb n="c57-0117__main__15"/> in for port. It was a very dark night as <lb n="c57-0117__main__16"/> the moon had not yet risen; They did not <lb n="c57-0117__main__17"/> lan<mdel/>d at the harbour but, as they had been <lb n="c57-0117__main__18"/> accustomed, at a creek about two miles <lb n="c57-0117__main__19"/> below. He went first carrying a part <lb n="c57-0117__main__20"/> of the fishing tackle & his companions <lb n="c57-0117__main__21"/> followed him at some distance. As he <lb n="c57-0117__main__22"/> was walking along the sands he <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0117__main__d3e21890"/>hit<del eID="c57-0117__main__d3e21890"/>struck his foot <lb n="c57-0117__main__23"/> against somthing & fell all his length on <lb n="c57-0117__main__24"/> the ground; his comrades came up to assist <lb n="c57-0117__main__25"/> him & by the light of their lantern they <lb n="c57-0117__main__26"/> discovered that he had fallen on the <lb n="c57-0117__main__27"/> body of a man who was to all appearance <lb n="c57-0117__main__28"/> dead.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0117__main__29"/> Their first supposition was that <lb n="c57-0117__main__30"/> it was the corpse of <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0117__main__d3e21919"/>man<del eID="c57-0117__main__d3e21919"/>some person who had been <lb n="c57-0117__main__31"/> drowned & thrown on shore by the waves, <lb n="c57-0117__main__32"/> But upon examination they found that <lb n="c57-0117__main__33"/> the clothes were not wet &<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>even that the body <lb n="c57-0117__main__34"/> was not yet cold. They instantly carried <lb n="c57-0117__main__35"/> it to the cottage of an old woman <lb n="c57-0117__main__36"/> near the spot& endeavoured <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>but in vain to restore it to life <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0117__main__d3e21967"/>but<del eID="c57-0117__main__d3e21967"/><lb n="c57-0118__main__1"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0118__main__d3e21980"/>In vain<del eID="c57-0118__main__d3e21980"/>. He appeared to have been a handsome <lb n="c57-0118__main__2"/> young man about twenty years of age. He <lb n="c57-0118__main__3"/> had apparently been strangled for there <lb n="c57-0118__main__4"/><lb n="c57-0118__left_margin__1"/>was no sign of any violence except the black <lb n="c57-0118__main__5"/> mark of fingers on his neck.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0118__main__6"/> The first <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>part of this deposition did not <lb n="c57-0118__main__7"/> in the least interrest me but when the <lb n="c57-0118__main__8"/> mark of the fingers was mentioned I remem<lb n="c57-0118__main__9"/>bered the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0118__main__d3e22029"/>the<del eID="c57-0118__main__d3e22029"/> murder of my brother & felt <lb n="c57-0118__main__10"/> myself extremely agitated; my limbs t<mdel>r</mdel>rembled <lb n="c57-0118__main__11"/>& a mist came over my eyes which obliged <lb n="c57-0118__main__12"/> me to lean on a chair for support; the <lb n="c57-0118__main__13"/> Magistrate observed me with a keen eye <lb n="c57-0118__main__14"/>& of course drew an unfavourable augury f<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>rom <lb n="c57-0118__main__15"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0118__main__d3e22070"/>it.<del eID="c57-0118__main__d3e22070"/> my manner.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0118__main__16"/> The son confirmed his fathers account <lb n="c57-0118__main__17"/> but when Daniel Nugent was questioned <lb n="c57-0118__main__18"/> he swore positively that just before the <lb n="c57-0118__main__19"/> fall of his companion he saw a boat with <lb n="c57-0118__main__20"/> a single man in it <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0118__main__d3e22088"/>push<del eID="c57-0118__main__d3e22088"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0118__main__d3e22091"/>about fifty yar<del eID="c57-0118__main__d3e22091"/><mdel>ds</mdel>at a short distance<lb n="c57-0118__main__21"/> from the shore & as far as he could judge <lb n="c57-0118__main__22"/> by the light of a few stars it was the same <lb n="c57-0118__main__23"/> boat in which I had just landed.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0118__main__24"/> A woman deposed that she lived near <lb n="c57-0118__main__25"/> the beach & was standing at the door of her <lb n="c57-0118__main__26"/> cottage waiting for the return <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0118__main__d3e22119"/>when<del eID="c57-0118__main__d3e22119"/>of the fisherman about <lb n="c57-0118__main__27"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0118__main__d3e22130"/>ten minutes<del eID="c57-0118__main__d3e22130"/><lb n="c57-0118__left_margin__1"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0118__left_margin__d3e22141"/>half a quarter of<del eID="c57-0118__left_margin__d3e22141"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0118__left_margin__d3e22147"/>half<del eID="c57-0118__left_margin__d3e22147"/>an hour before she heard of the dis<lb n="c57-0118__main__28"/>covery of the body she saw a boat with only <lb n="c57-0118__main__29"/> one <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0118__main__d3e22168"/>w<del eID="c57-0118__main__d3e22168"/> man in it push off from that <lb n="c57-0118__main__30"/> part of the shore where the corpse was <lb n="c57-0118__main__31"/> afterwards found.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0118__main__32"/> Another woman confirmed the ac<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0118__main__d3e22182"/>c<del eID="c57-0118__main__d3e22182"/><lb n="c57-0118__main__33"/>count of the fisherman having brought the <lb n="c57-0118__main__34"/> bo<mdel>at</mdel>dy into her house.–It was not cold &<lb n="c57-0118__main__35"/> they put <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>it into a bed & rubbed it and Daniel<lb n="c57-0119__main__1"/> went to the town for an appothecary, but <lb n="c57-0119__main__2"/> life was quite gone.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0119__main__3"/> Several other men <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0119__main__d3e22232"/>deposed con<del eID="c57-0119__main__d3e22232"/><lb n="c57-0119__main__4"/> were examined concerning my landing & they <lb n="c57-0119__main__5"/> agreed that with the strong north wind that <lb n="c57-0119__main__6"/> had arrisen during the night it was very <lb n="c57-0119__main__7"/> probable that I had beaten about for <lb n="c57-0119__main__8"/> many hours & have been obliged to return <lb n="c57-0119__main__9"/><lb n="c57-0119__left_margin__1"/>nearly to the same <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0119__main__d3e22261"/>place<del eID="c57-0119__main__d3e22261"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>spot from which I had <lb n="c57-0119__main__10"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0119__main__d3e22276"/>set out<del eID="c57-0119__main__d3e22276"/> departed. Besides, they observed, <lb n="c57-0119__main__11"/> that it appeared I had brought the body <lb n="c57-0119__main__12"/> from another place & it was likely <lb n="c57-0119__main__13"/> that <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0119__main__d3e22286"/>I might<del eID="c57-0119__main__d3e22286"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0119__main__d3e22289"/>p<del eID="c57-0119__main__d3e22289"/> as I did not appear to know <lb n="c57-0119__main__14"/> the shore I might have put in to the <lb n="c57-0119__main__15"/> harbour ignorant of the distance <lb n="c57-0119__main__16"/> of the town of —— from the place where <lb n="c57-0119__main__17"/> I had deposited the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0119__main__d3e22304"/>body<del eID="c57-0119__main__d3e22304"/><del rend="unmarked" sID="c57-0119__main__d3e22307"/>.<del eID="c57-0119__main__d3e22307"/> corpse.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0119__main__18"/>>M<shi rend="sup">r</shi>. Kirwin on hearing this evidence <lb n="c57-0119__main__19"/> desired that I should be taken into the <lb n="c57-0119__main__20"/> room where the body lay for interment <lb n="c57-0119__main__21"/> that it might be observed what effect <lb n="c57-0119__main__22"/> the sight of it would produce<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0119__main__d3e22330"/>d<del eID="c57-0119__main__d3e22330"/> upon me. <lb n="c57-0119__main__23"/> This idea was probably suggested by <lb n="c57-0119__main__24"/> the extreme agitation I had exhibited <lb n="c57-0119__main__25"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0119__main__d3e22339"/>th<del eID="c57-0119__main__d3e22339"/> when the mode of the murder had <lb n="c57-0119__main__26"/> been <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0119__main__d3e22345"/>describ<del eID="c57-0119__main__d3e22345"/> described. I was according<lb n="c57-0119__main__27"/>ly conducted by the Magistrate & several <lb n="c57-0119__main__28"/> other persons to the Inn. I could not <lb n="c57-0119__main__29"/> help being struck by the strange coin<lb n="c57-0119__main__30"/>cidences that had taken place during <lb n="c57-0119__main__31"/> this eventful night but knowing that <lb n="c57-0119__main__32"/> I had been <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0119__main__d3e22369"/>in<del eID="c57-0119__main__d3e22369"/> conversing with several <lb n="c57-0119__main__33"/> persons in the island I had inhabited <lb n="c57-0119__main__34"/> about the time that the body <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0119__main__d3e22379"/>was<del eID="c57-0119__main__d3e22379"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>had been found<lb n="c57-0120__main__1"/> I was perfectly tranquil as to the consequences of the <lb n="c57-0120__main__2"/> affair.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0120__main__3"/> I entered the room where the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0120__main__d3e22410"/>body<del eID="c57-0120__main__d3e22410"/>corpse lay <lb n="c57-0120__main__4"/>& was led up to the coffin. How can I describle?<lb n="c57-0120__main__5"/> my sensation. I feel yet parched with horror <lb n="c57-0120__main__6"/> nor can I ever reflect on that terrible <lb n="c57-0120__main__7"/> moment without shuddering & agony that <lb n="c57-0120__main__8"/>faintly reminds of the anguish of <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>therecogni<lb n="c57-0120__main__9"/>tion. The trial, the presence of the <lb n="c57-0120__main__10"/> magistrate & witnesses passed like a <lb n="c57-0120__main__11"/> dream from my memory when I saw <lb n="c57-0120__main__12"/> the lifeless form of Henry Cl<mdel>ai</mdel><metamark>^</metamark>erval <lb n="c57-0120__main__13"/> stretched before me – I gasped for breath <lb n="c57-0120__main__14"/>& throwing myself on the body I exclaim<lb n="c57-0120__main__15"/>ed. And have my murderous machi<lb n="c57-0120__main__16"/>nations deprived you <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0120__main__d3e22499"/>alls<del eID="c57-0120__main__d3e22499"/> also my <lb n="c57-0120__main__17"/> dearest Henry of life— Two <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0120__main__d3e22504"/>w<del eID="c57-0120__main__d3e22504"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0120__main__d3e22507"/>victims<del eID="c57-0120__main__d3e22507"/><lb n="c57-0120__main__18"/> I have already destroyed; other victims <lb n="c57-0120__main__19"/> await their destinny – But you, Cl<mdel/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>erval, <lb n="c57-0120__main__20"/> my frend, my benefactor!—<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0120__main__21"/> The human frame could no longer <lb n="c57-0120__main__22"/> support the agonizing suffering that I <lb n="c57-0120__main__23"/> endured & I was carried out of the room <lb n="c57-0120__main__24"/> in strong convulsions.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0120__main__25"/> A fever succeeded to this. I lay for two <lb n="c57-0120__main__26"/> months on the point of death. My ravings, <lb n="c57-0120__main__27"/> as I afterwards heard were frightful. I called <lb n="c57-0120__main__28"/> myself the murderer of William <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0120__main__d3e22566"/>of<del eID="c57-0120__main__d3e22566"/>Jus Wil <lb n="c57-0120__main__29"/> liam, <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0120__main__d3e22576"/>&<del eID="c57-0120__main__d3e22576"/> of Justine & of <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0120__main__d3e22579"/>Cl<del eID="c57-0120__main__d3e22579"/> Cl<mdel>ai</mdel><metamark place="sublinear">^</metamark>erval. Sometimes <lb n="c57-0120__main__30"/> I entreated my attendants to assist me in <lb n="c57-0120__main__31"/> the destruction of the fiend by whom <lb n="c57-0120__main__32"/> I was tormented – and at others I felt the <lb n="c57-0120__main__33"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0120__main__d3e22611"/>fangs<del eID="c57-0120__main__d3e22611"/><lb n="c57-0120__left_margin__1"/>fingers of the mosnster already grasping my<lb n="c57-0121__main__1"/> neck & screamed aloud with agony & terror. <lb n="c57-0121__main__2"/> Fortunately as I spoke my native tongue <lb n="c57-0121__main__3"/> M<shi rend="sup">r</shi>. Kirwin alone understood <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>me. But my gestures <lb n="c57-0121__main__4"/> and bitter cries were sufficient, to affright <lb n="c57-0121__main__5"/> the other witnesses.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0121__main__6"/> Why did I not die? More miserable <lb n="c57-0121__main__7"/> than man ever was before why did I <lb n="c57-0121__main__8"/> not sink into rest & forgetfullness? Death <lb n="c57-0121__main__9"/> snatches away many blooming children the <lb n="c57-0121__main__10"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0121__main__d3e22678"/>oly<del eID="c57-0121__main__d3e22678"/> only hopes of their doating <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0121__main__d3e22681"/>per<del eID="c57-0121__main__d3e22681"/> parents; <lb n="c57-0121__main__11"/> How many brides & youthful lovers have <lb n="c57-0121__main__12"/> been one day in the bloom of health &<lb n="c57-0121__main__13"/> hope & the next a prey for worms & the <lb n="c57-0121__main__14"/> decay of the tomb! Of what materials was I <lb n="c57-0121__main__15"/> made <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0121__main__d3e22695"/>w<del eID="c57-0121__main__d3e22695"/> that I could thus resist so many <lb n="c57-0121__main__16"/> shocks which like the turning of the wheel <lb n="c57-0121__main__17"/><lb n="c57-0121__left_margin__1"/>continually renewed the torture.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0121__main__18"/> But I was doomed to live & in two <lb n="c57-0121__main__19"/> months found myself <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>as awaking from a <lb n="c57-0121__main__20"/> dream, in a prison, stretched on a wretched <lb n="c57-0121__main__21"/> bed surrounded by gailors–turnkeys, bolts <lb n="c57-0121__main__22"/>& all the miserable apparatus of a dungeon <lb n="c57-0121__main__23"/> It was morning I remember when I thus awoke <lb n="c57-0121__main__24"/>I had forgotten <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>the particulars of what had happened & only <lb n="c57-0121__main__25"/> felt as if some great misery had over<lb n="c57-0121__main__26"/>come me. But when I looked around <lb n="c57-0121__main__27"/> and saw the barred windows, & the <lb n="c57-0121__main__28"/> squalidness of the room in which I was, <lb n="c57-0121__main__29"/> all flashed across my memory –& I <lb n="c57-0121__main__30"/> groaned bitterly. This sound disturbed an <lb n="c57-0121__main__31"/> old woman who was sleeping in a <lb n="c57-0121__main__32"/> chair beside me. She was a hired nurse, <lb n="c57-0121__main__33"/> the wife of one of the turnkeys & her <lb n="c57-0121__main__34"/> countenance expressed all those bad qua<lb n="c57-0121__main__35"/>lities which <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0121__main__d3e22799"/>usually<del eID="c57-0121__main__d3e22799"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>often characterize <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0121__main__d3e22812"/>that<del eID="c57-0121__main__d3e22812"/><lb n="c57-0122__main__1"/> that class. her face was hard & rude like that <lb n="c57-0122__main__2"/> of per<mdel/>sons accustomed to see without sympa<lb n="c57-0122__main__3"/>thizing in sights of misery. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0122__main__d3e22845"/>She spoke with a<del eID="c57-0122__main__d3e22845"/><lb n="c57-0122__main__4"/><lb n="c57-0122__left_margin__1"/>Her voice <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0122__main__d3e22865"/>that<del eID="c57-0122__main__d3e22865"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>expressed her entire indifference – She <lb n="c57-0122__main__5"/> addressed me in Eglish & the words struck <lb n="c57-0122__main__6"/> me as one that I had heard during my suff <lb n="c57-0122__main__7"/> erings– Are you better now, <mdel>s</mdel>Sir, said she.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0122__main__8"/> I replied in the same language <lb n="c57-0122__main__9"/> with a feeble voice; I believe I am but <lb n="c57-0122__main__10"/> if it all be true – if indeed I did not <lb n="c57-0122__main__11"/> dream I am sorry that I am still alive <lb n="c57-0122__main__12"/> to feel misery & horror.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0122__main__13"/> For that matter, replied the old <lb n="c57-0122__main__14"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0122__main__d3e22919"/>wan<del eID="c57-0122__main__d3e22919"/> woman, if you mean about <lb n="c57-0122__main__15"/> the gentleman that you murdered I <lb n="c57-0122__main__16"/> believe that it were better for you <lb n="c57-0122__main__17"/> if you were dead – for I fancy it will <lb n="c57-0122__main__18"/> go hard with you, <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0122__main__d3e22931"/>but<del eID="c57-0122__main__d3e22931"/> you will be <lb n="c57-0122__main__19"/> hanged when the next session comes <lb n="c57-0122__main__20"/> on – however that is none of my business <lb n="c57-0122__main__21"/> I am sent <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0122__main__d3e22941"/>for<del eID="c57-0122__main__d3e22941"/> to nurse you & get <lb n="c57-0122__main__22"/> you well–I do <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0122__main__d3e22946"/>no more<del eID="c57-0122__main__d3e22946"/> my duty with <lb n="c57-0122__main__23"/> a safe conscience; it were well if every<lb n="c57-0122__main__24"/>body did the same.–<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0122__main__25"/> I turned <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0122__main__d3e22962"/>fro<del eID="c57-0122__main__d3e22962"/> with lo<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0122__main__d3e22965"/>o<del eID="c57-0122__main__d3e22965"/>athing from <lb n="c57-0122__main__26"/> the woman who could utter so un<lb n="c57-0122__main__27"/>feeling a speech to <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>a<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0122__main__d3e22991"/>man<del eID="c57-0122__main__d3e22991"/>person just saved on <lb n="c57-0122__main__28"/> the very edge of death; but I felt languid <lb n="c57-0122__main__29"/> and unable to reflect on all that had <lb n="c57-0122__main__30"/> passed; <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0122__main__d3e23007"/>It sometimes<del eID="c57-0122__main__d3e23007"/>The whole series of my life appeared as a dream <lb n="c57-0122__main__31"/> I sometimes <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0122__main__d3e23016"/>I<del eID="c57-0122__main__d3e23016"/> doubted if indeed it was not <lb n="c57-0122__main__32"/> all true but it never presented itself to<lb n="c57-0123__main__1"/> my mind with the face of reality.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0123__main__2"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0123__main__d3e23036"/>But<del eID="c57-0123__main__d3e23036"/><mdel>a</mdel>As the images that floated <lb n="c57-0123__main__3"/> before me became more distinct I grew <lb n="c57-0123__main__4"/> feverish; a darkness pressed around me<lb n="c57-0123__main__5"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0123__main__d3e23060"/>and<del eID="c57-0123__main__d3e23060"/> no person was near me who soothed <lb n="c57-0123__main__6"/> me with the gentle voice of love; no <lb n="c57-0123__main__7"/> dear hand supported me. The ph<mdel>i</mdel>ys<del rend="overwritten" sID="c57-0123__main__d3e23079"/><mdel>i</mdel>y<del eID="c57-0123__main__d3e23079"/>i<lb n="c57-0123__main__8"/> cian came & prescribed medecines & the <lb n="c57-0123__main__9"/> old woman prepared them for me <lb n="c57-0123__main__10"/> but utter carelessness was visible in <lb n="c57-0123__main__11"/> the first & the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0123__main__d3e23106"/>marks<del eID="c57-0123__main__d3e23106"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>expression of brutality <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0123__main__d3e23121"/>were<del eID="c57-0123__main__d3e23121"/><lb n="c57-0123__left_margin__1"/>was <lb n="c57-0123__main__12"/> strongly impressed on the visage of <lb n="c57-0123__main__13"/> the second – <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0123__main__d3e23139"/>Besides<del eID="c57-0123__main__d3e23139"/> who could be <lb n="c57-0123__main__14"/> inte<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0123__main__d3e23145"/>r<del eID="c57-0123__main__d3e23145"/>rested in the fate of a murderer <lb n="c57-0123__main__15"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0123__main__d3e23150"/>none<del eID="c57-0123__main__d3e23150"/> but the hangman who would <lb n="c57-0123__main__16"/> gain his fee? if he recovered only to <lb n="c57-0123__main__17"/> die by his hands.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0123__main__18"/> These were my first reflections <lb n="c57-0123__main__19"/> but I soon learned that M<shi rend="sup">r</shi>. Kir<lb n="c57-0123__main__20"/>win had shewn me extreme <lb n="c57-0123__main__21"/> kindness – He had caused the best room <lb n="c57-0123__main__22"/> in the prison to be prepared for me, <lb n="c57-0123__main__23"/> (wretched indeed was the best) And it <lb n="c57-0123__main__24"/> was he who had provided a physician <lb n="c57-0123__main__25"/>& attendants for me. It is true he sel<lb n="c57-0123__main__26"/>dom came to see me for although <lb n="c57-0123__main__27"/> he ardently desired to relieve the suffe<lb n="c57-0123__main__28"/>rings of every human creature he did <lb n="c57-0123__main__29"/> not wish to be present at the agonies <lb n="c57-0123__main__30"/> and miserable ravings of a murderer— <lb n="c57-0123__main__31"/> He came therefore sometimes to see <lb n="c57-0123__main__32"/> that I was not neglected, but his visits <lb n="c57-0123__main__33"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0123__main__d3e23215"/>wh<del eID="c57-0123__main__d3e23215"/> were short & at <mdel/>long intervals.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0123__main__34"/> One day when I was gradually re<lb n="c57-0123__main__35"/>covering<mdel>&</mdel>I was seated in a chair, my eyes half<lb n="c57-0124__main__1"/><lb n="c57-0124__left_margin__1"/>open,and my cheeks livid like those of death I was <lb n="c57-0124__main__2"/> overcome by gloom & misery and often <lb n="c57-0124__main__3"/> reflected whether I had better not seek death <lb n="c57-0124__main__4"/> that wait miserably pent up only to be <lb n="c57-0124__main__5"/> let loose in a world replete with <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0124__main__d3e23278"/>whrect<del eID="c57-0124__main__d3e23278"/><lb n="c57-0124__main__6"/>wretchedness. At one time I considered whether <lb n="c57-0124__main__7"/> I should not delare myself guilty & suffer <lb n="c57-0124__main__8"/> the penalty of the law which in depriving <lb n="c57-0124__main__9"/> me of <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0124__main__d3e23295"/>w<del eID="c57-0124__main__d3e23295"/> life would afford the only consola<lb n="c57-0124__main__10"/>tion that I was capable of receiving. Such <lb n="c57-0124__main__11"/> were my thoughts when the door of my <lb n="c57-0124__main__12"/> prison opened and M<shi rend="sup">r</shi>. Kirwin entered. <lb n="c57-0124__main__13"/> His countenance expressed sympathy <lb n="c57-0124__main__14"/> and kindness: he drew a chair close to <lb n="c57-0124__main__15"/> mine & addressed me in french.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0124__main__16"/> I fear, <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0124__main__d3e23326"/>said he<del eID="c57-0124__main__d3e23326"/>, that this place <lb n="c57-0124__main__17"/> is very shocking to you; Can I do anything <lb n="c57-0124__main__18"/> to make you more comfortable.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0124__main__19"/> I thank you, replied I, but all <lb n="c57-0124__main__20"/> that you mention is nothing to me; <lb n="c57-0124__main__21"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0124__main__d3e23342"/>No one on earth is capable<del eID="c57-0124__main__d3e23342"/> on the <lb n="c57-0124__main__22"/> whole earth there is no comfort which <lb n="c57-0124__main__23"/> I am capable of receiving.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0124__main__24"/> I know, <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0124__main__d3e23354"/>said M<shi rend="sup">r</shi>. Kirwin,<del eID="c57-0124__main__d3e23354"/> that the <lb n="c57-0124__main__25"/> sympathy of a stranger can be <mdel>of</mdel><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>but little <lb n="c57-0124__main__26"/> relief to one borne down as you are by <lb n="c57-0124__main__27"/> so strange a misfortune But you <lb n="c57-0124__main__28"/> will I hope soon quit this unhappy <lb n="c57-0124__main__29"/> abode– for doubtless <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>evidence can be easily brought <lb n="c57-0124__main__30"/> to free you from the criminal charge<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0124__main__31"/> That, <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0124__main__d3e23408"/>I replied<del eID="c57-0124__main__d3e23408"/> is my least concern–I <lb n="c57-0124__main__32"/> am by a course of strange events, become <lb n="c57-0124__main__33"/> the most miserable of mortals. Persecuted <lb n="c57-0124__main__34"/>& tortured as I am & have been can death<lb n="c57-0125__main__1"/> be any evil to me?<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0125__main__2"/> Nothing indeed <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0125__main__d3e23433"/>said M<shi rend="underline"></shi> Kirwin<del eID="c57-0125__main__d3e23433"/> could <lb n="c57-0125__main__3"/> be more unfortunate & agonizing than the strange <lb n="c57-0125__main__4"/> chances that have lately <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0125__main__d3e23450"/>taken<del eID="c57-0125__main__d3e23450"/> occurred. <lb n="c57-0125__main__5"/> You were thrown, by some surprising <lb n="c57-0125__main__6"/> accident, on this shore, renowned for its <lb n="c57-0125__main__7"/> hospitality <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0125__main__d3e23460"/>but prejudiced against you.<del eID="c57-0125__main__d3e23460"/><lb n="c57-0125__main__8"/> Siezed immediately & charged with murder <lb n="c57-0125__main__9"/> the first sight that was presented to your <lb n="c57-0125__main__10"/> eyes was the body of your friend mur<lb n="c57-0125__main__11"/>dered in so unaccountable a manner <lb n="c57-0125__main__12"/> and placed by some fiend as it were across <lb n="c57-0125__main__13"/> your path— <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0125__main__d3e23480"/>I What a<del eID="c57-0125__main__d3e23480"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0125__main__d3e23483"/>Could such incidents<del eID="c57-0125__main__d3e23483"/><milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0125__main__14"/> As M<shi rend="sup">r</shi>. Kirwin said this, notwithstanding <lb n="c57-0125__main__15"/> the agitation that I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0125__main__d3e23496"/>fel<del eID="c57-0125__main__d3e23496"/> endured on this <lb n="c57-0125__main__16"/> retrospect of my sufferings–I also felt <lb n="c57-0125__main__17"/> considerable surprise at the knowledge <lb n="c57-0125__main__18"/> he seemed to possess concerning me. <lb n="c57-0125__main__19"/> I suppose some astonishment was expressed <lb n="c57-0125__main__20"/> in my countenance – for M<shi rend="sup">r</shi>. Kirwin <lb n="c57-0125__main__21"/> hastened to say – It was not untill a day <lb n="c57-0125__main__22"/> or two after your illness that I thought <lb n="c57-0125__main__23"/> of examining your dress that I might <lb n="c57-0125__main__24"/> discover some trace by which I could <lb n="c57-0125__main__25"/> send to your relations an account of your <lb n="c57-0125__main__26"/> misfortune and illness. I found several letters <lb n="c57-0125__main__27"/> among others one <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>which I discovered by its commence<lb n="c57-0125__main__28"/>ment to be from your father – I instant<lb n="c57-0125__main__29"/>ly wrote to Geneva – nearly two months has <lb n="c57-0125__main__30"/> passed since the departure of my letter — <lb n="c57-0125__main__31"/> But you are ill – even now you tremble <lb n="c57-0125__main__32"/><lb n="c57-0125__left_margin__1"/>You appear unfit for agitation of any kind.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0125__main__33"/> This suspence, <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0125__main__d3e23575"/>I cried<del eID="c57-0125__main__d3e23575"/> is a thousand <lb n="c57-0125__main__34"/> times worse than the most horrible <lb n="c57-0125__main__35"/> event –Tell me what new scene of dea<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0125__main__d3e23582"/>l<del eID="c57-0125__main__d3e23582"/>th <lb n="c57-0125__main__36"/> has been acted & whose murder I am <lb n="c57-0125__main__37"/> now to lament.<lb n="c57-0126__main__1"/> Your family are all perfectly <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0126__main__d3e23600"/>well<del eID="c57-0126__main__d3e23600"/> well, said <lb n="c57-0126__main__2"/> M<shi rend="sup">r</shi>. Kirwinsaid M<shi rend="sup">r</shi>. Kirwin, with gentleness; and some one, a <lb n="c57-0126__main__3"/> friend, is come to visit you.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0126__main__4"/> I do not know by what chain of <lb n="c57-0126__main__5"/> thought the idea presented itself but it <lb n="c57-0126__main__6"/> instantly darted into my mind that the <lb n="c57-0126__main__7"/> monster had come to mock at my misery <lb n="c57-0126__main__8"/>& taunt me with the death of Cl<mdel>ai</mdel><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>erval <lb n="c57-0126__main__9"/> as a new incitement to comply with <lb n="c57-0126__main__10"/> his hellish desires. I put my hand before <lb n="c57-0126__main__11"/> my eyes & cried out in agony –Oh! take <lb n="c57-0126__main__12"/> him away – I cannot see him for Gods <lb n="c57-0126__main__13"/> sake do not let him enter!<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0126__main__14"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0126__main__d3e23667"/>M<shi rend="sup">r</shi>. Kirwin changed countenance<del eID="c57-0126__main__d3e23667"/><milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0126__main__15"/> M<shi rend="sup">r</shi>. Kirwin regarded me with a <lb n="c57-0126__main__16"/> troubled countenance. He could not <lb n="c57-0126__main__17"/> help regarding my exclamation as a <lb n="c57-0126__main__18"/> presumption of my guilt & said in <lb n="c57-0126__main__19"/> rather severe tone – I should have <lb n="c57-0126__main__20"/> thought, young man, that the presence <lb n="c57-0126__main__21"/> of your Father would have been <lb n="c57-0126__main__22"/> welcome instead of inpiring such <lb n="c57-0126__main__23"/> violent repugnance.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0126__main__24"/> My father, said, I, while every fea<lb n="c57-0126__main__25"/>ture& every muscle was relaxed from <lb n="c57-0126__main__26"/>anguish to pleasure – Is my father indeed <lb n="c57-0126__main__27"/> come – how kind, how very kind! But <lb n="c57-0126__main__28"/>where is he, why does he not hasten <lb n="c57-0126__main__29"/> to me?<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0126__main__30"/> My change of manner suprised &<lb n="c57-0126__main__31"/> pleased <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0126__main__d3e23732"/>M<shi rend="sup">r</shi>. Kirwin<del eID="c57-0126__main__d3e23732"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>the magistrate, perhaps he thought <lb n="c57-0126__main__32"/> that my former exclamation was a<lb n="c57-0127__main__1"/> momentary return of delirium and <lb n="c57-0127__main__2"/> now he instantly resumed his former <lb n="c57-0127__main__3"/> benevolence – He rose and quitted the room <lb n="c57-0127__main__4"/> with my nurse & in a minute my father <lb n="c57-0127__main__5"/> entered it.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0127__main__6"/> Nothing at this moment could <lb n="c57-0127__main__7"/> have given my greater pleasure than <lb n="c57-0127__main__8"/> the arrival of my father – I stretched <lb n="c57-0127__main__9"/> out my hand to him & cried – Are you then <lb n="c57-0127__main__10"/> safe & Elizabeth & Ernest.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0127__main__11"/> My father calmed me by his assu<lb n="c57-0127__main__12"/>rances of their welfare & told me <lb n="c57-0127__main__13"/> that he had not communicated my <lb n="c57-0127__main__14"/> imprisonment to my cousin but <lb n="c57-0127__main__15"/> merely mentioned my <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0127__main__d3e23802"/>he<del eID="c57-0127__main__d3e23802"/> illness—And <lb n="c57-0127__main__16"/> what a place this is that you inhabit, <lb n="c57-0127__main__17"/> my son continued he looking mourn <lb n="c57-0127__main__18"/> fully at the barred window<mdel>n</mdel>s and the <lb n="c57-0127__main__19"/> wretched appearance of the room; <lb n="c57-0127__main__20"/> You travelled to seek happiness but <lb n="c57-0127__main__21"/> a fatality seems to <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0127__main__d3e23829"/>hang over<del eID="c57-0127__main__d3e23829"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>pursue you –And <lb n="c57-0127__main__22"/> poor Cl<mdel>ai</mdel>erval.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0127__main__23"/> The name of my unfortunate &<lb n="c57-0127__main__24"/> murdered friend <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0127__main__d3e23860"/>agitated<del eID="c57-0127__main__d3e23860"/> was too great <lb n="c57-0127__main__25"/> an agitation to be endured in my <lb n="c57-0127__main__26"/> weak state—I shed tears; Alas, yes, my father <lb n="c57-0127__main__27"/> said I, <mdel>a</mdel>somedestiny of the most horrible <lb n="c57-0127__main__28"/> kind hangs over me, and I must live to <lb n="c57-0127__main__29"/> fulfil it, or surely I should have died <lb n="c57-0127__main__30"/> on the coffin of Henry.<lb n="c57-0128__main__1"/><milestone spanTo="#c57-0128.02" unit="tei:head"/>Chap. 15<lb n="c57-0128__main__2"/> We were not allowed to converse for any length <lb n="c57-0128__main__3"/> of time for the precarious state of my health rendered <lb n="c57-0128__main__4"/> every precaution <metamark function="insert">^</metamark><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0128__main__d3e23921"/>that<del eID="c57-0128__main__d3e23921"/> necessary that could ensure tranquillity. M<shi rend="sup">r</shi>.. Kirwin came in &<lb n="c57-0128__main__5"/> insisted that my <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0128__main__d3e23938"/>forces<del eID="c57-0128__main__d3e23938"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>strength should not be exhausted <lb n="c57-0128__main__6"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0128__main__d3e23954"/>by a prolonged con<del eID="c57-0128__main__d3e23954"/> by too much exertion. But <lb n="c57-0128__main__7"/> the appearance of my father was to me like <lb n="c57-0128__main__8"/> that of my good angel, and I gradually recovered my <lb n="c57-0128__main__9"/> health. As my sickness quitted me I was absorbed <lb n="c57-0128__main__10"/> by a <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>gloomy & black melancholy that nothing could dissipate– <lb n="c57-0128__main__11"/> The image of Cl<mdel>ai</mdel>erval was for ever before me <lb n="c57-0128__main__12"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0128__main__d3e23995"/>pale<del eID="c57-0128__main__d3e23995"/><lb n="c57-0128__left_margin__1"/>ghastly& murdered – More than once the agitation <lb n="c57-0128__main__13"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0128__main__d3e24014"/>that<del eID="c57-0128__main__d3e24014"/>into which these reflections threw me into made my <lb n="c57-0128__main__14"/> friends dread a dangerous relapse<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0128__main__15"/> Alas! Why did they preserve so miserable <lb n="c57-0128__main__16"/> and detested a life? It was surely that I <lb n="c57-0128__main__17"/> might fulfil my destiny which is drawing <lb n="c57-0128__main__18"/> to a close— Soon Oh very soon will death <lb n="c57-0128__main__19"/> extinguish these throbbings <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>releive me from this mighty weight <lb n="c57-0128__main__20"/> of anguish that bears me to the <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0128__main__d3e24057"/>ground<del eID="c57-0128__main__d3e24057"/><lb n="c57-0128__main__21"/> dust and in ex<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0128__main__d3e24062"/>c<del eID="c57-0128__main__d3e24062"/>ecuting the award of jus<lb n="c57-0128__main__22"/>tice I shall also <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0128__main__d3e24072"/>thin<del eID="c57-0128__main__d3e24072"/> sink to rest. Then <lb n="c57-0128__main__23"/> the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0128__main__d3e24079"/>thought<del eID="c57-0128__main__d3e24079"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>appearance of death was distant although <lb n="c57-0128__main__24"/> the wish was ever present to my thoughts <lb n="c57-0128__main__25"/>& I often sat for hours motionless &speech<lb n="c57-0128__main__26"/>less wishing for some mighty revolution <lb n="c57-0128__main__27"/> that might bury me & my destroyer in <lb n="c57-0128__main__28"/> its ruins.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0128__main__29"/> The season of the assizes approached– <lb n="c57-0128__main__30"/> I had already been three months in prison <lb n="c57-0128__main__31"/>&<del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0128__main__d3e24118"/>allth<del eID="c57-0128__main__d3e24118"/> although I was still weak &<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0128__main__d3e24121"/>feverish<del eID="c57-0128__main__d3e24121"/><lb n="c57-0128__main__32"/> in continual danger of a relapse I was <lb n="c57-0128__main__33"/> obliged to travel nearly a hundred miles to <lb n="c57-0128__main__34"/> the county town where the court was held. <lb n="c57-0128__main__35"/> M<shi rend="sup">r</shi>. Kirwin charged himself with every<lb n="c57-0129__main__1"/> care of collecting witnesses and arranging <lb n="c57-0129__main__2"/> my defence– I was <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0129__main__d3e24148"/>p<del eID="c57-0129__main__d3e24148"/> spared the disgrace <lb n="c57-0129__main__3"/> of appearing <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0129__main__d3e24155"/>in the court<del eID="c57-0129__main__d3e24155"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>publickly as a criminal as <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0129__main__d3e24169"/>my trial did<del eID="c57-0129__main__d3e24169"/><lb n="c57-0129__main__4"/> the case was not brought before the last <lb n="c57-0129__main__5"/> court court that decides on life & death— <lb n="c57-0129__main__6"/> The Gran<mdel/>d Jury rejected the bill on its being <lb n="c57-0129__main__7"/> proved that I was in the orkney Island <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0129__main__d3e24199"/>the<del eID="c57-0129__main__d3e24199"/><lb n="c57-0129__main__8"/> at the hour the body <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0129__main__d3e24206"/>was f<del eID="c57-0129__main__d3e24206"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0129__main__d3e24209"/>of m<del eID="c57-0129__main__d3e24209"/> of my friend was <lb n="c57-0129__main__9"/> found. And a fortnight after my removal <lb n="c57-0129__main__10"/> I was liberated from prison—My father was <lb n="c57-0129__main__11"/> enraptured on finding me freed from the <lb n="c57-0129__main__12"/> vexations of a criminal charge & that <lb n="c57-0129__main__13"/> I was again permitted to breathe the fresh <lb n="c57-0129__main__14"/> atmosphere & allowed to return to my <lb n="c57-0129__main__15"/> native country. I did not participate in <lb n="c57-0129__main__16"/> these feelings for to me the walls of a <lb n="c57-0129__main__17"/> dungeon or a <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0129__main__d3e24239"/>plal<del eID="c57-0129__main__d3e24239"/> palace were alike <lb n="c57-0129__main__18"/> hateful – The cup of life was <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0129__main__d3e24245"/>to me<del eID="c57-0129__main__d3e24245"/> poisoned <lb n="c57-0129__main__19"/> for ever & although the sun shone upon <lb n="c57-0129__main__20"/> me as <mdel>in</mdel><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>upon the happy &<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0129__main__d3e24267"/>light<del eID="c57-0129__main__d3e24267"/>gay of heart I <lb n="c57-0129__main__21"/> saw around me nothing but a dense &<lb n="c57-0129__main__22"/> frightful darkness penetrated by no glimmer <lb n="c57-0129__main__23"/> but <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0129__main__d3e24280"/>that of<del eID="c57-0129__main__d3e24280"/> the light of two eyes that <lb n="c57-0129__main__24"/> glared upon me.– Sometimes they were <lb n="c57-0129__main__25"/> the expressive eyes of Henry languishing <lb n="c57-0129__main__26"/> in death – the dark orbs nearly covered by <lb n="c57-0129__main__27"/> the lid & the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0129__main__d3e24292"/>the<del eID="c57-0129__main__d3e24292"/> long lashes that fringed <lb n="c57-0129__main__28"/> it – Sometimes it was the watry clouded <lb n="c57-0129__main__29"/> eyes of the monster as I first saw them <lb n="c57-0129__main__30"/><mdel>at</mdel>in my chamber at Ingolstadt<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0129__main__31"/> My father tried to awake <mdel>a</mdel><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>in me the feelings <lb n="c57-0129__main__32"/> of affection — He talked of Geneva which I <lb n="c57-0129__main__33"/> should soon visit – Of Elizabeth & Ernest <lb n="c57-0129__main__34"/> But these words only drew from me deep <lb n="c57-0129__main__35"/> groans — Sometimes indeed I felt a wish<lb n="c57-0130__main__1"/><lb n="c57-0130__left_margin__1"/>for happiness; my beloved cousin & the blue lake which had <lb n="c57-0130__main__2"/> been so dear to me, in early childhood, but my <lb n="c57-0130__main__3"/> general <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>state of feeling was <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>a torpor in which a prison <lb n="c57-0130__main__4"/> was as welcome a <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0130__main__d3e24390"/>scene<del eID="c57-0130__main__d3e24390"/> residence as the divi<lb n="c57-0130__main__5"/>nest scene in nature & these fits were seldom <lb n="c57-0130__main__6"/> interrupted but by paroxisms of anguish &<lb n="c57-0130__main__7"/> despair – At these moments I often endeavour<lb n="c57-0130__main__8"/>ed to put an end to the existence I loathed <lb n="c57-0130__main__9"/>& it required unceasing attendance & vigilance <lb n="c57-0130__main__10"/> to <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0130__main__d3e24417"/>prevent<del eID="c57-0130__main__d3e24417"/>restrain<mdel>my</mdel><mdel>me</mdel> me from committing some dreadful <lb n="c57-0130__main__11"/> act of violence. I remember as I quitted the <lb n="c57-0130__main__12"/> prison I heard one of the men say – He may be <lb n="c57-0130__main__13"/> innocent of the murder but he has certainly <lb n="c57-0130__main__14"/> a bad conscien<mdel>s</mdel>ce.–<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0130__main__15"/> These words struck me; a bad conscience, <lb n="c57-0130__main__16"/> yes surely I had one – William, Justine & Cl<mdel>ai</mdel><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>erval <lb n="c57-0130__main__17"/> had died <mdel>by</mdel><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>through my infernal machinations <lb n="c57-0130__main__18"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0130__main__d3e24495"/>And who is <metamark function="insert">^</metamark><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0130__main__d3e24505"/>to be the<del eID="c57-0130__main__d3e24505"/> next victim I exclaimed<del eID="c57-0130__main__d3e24495"/> And whose <lb n="c57-0130__main__19"/> death, cried I, is to finish the tragedy — Ah! my <lb n="c57-0130__main__20"/> father do not let us remain in this wretched <lb n="c57-0130__main__21"/> country– Take me where I can forget myself, <lb n="c57-0130__main__22"/> my existence & all the world. My father easily <lb n="c57-0130__main__23"/> acceeded to my desire & after having taken <lb n="c57-0130__main__24"/> leave of M<shi rend="sup">r</shi>. Kirwin we hastened to Dublin. <lb n="c57-0130__main__25"/> I felt as if I was relieved from a heavy weight <lb n="c57-0130__main__26"/> when the packet set sail with a fair wind <lb n="c57-0130__main__27"/> from Ireland and I had quitted for ever the <lb n="c57-0130__main__28"/> country which had been to me the scene <lb n="c57-0130__main__29"/> of so much misery – It was midnight, my <lb n="c57-0130__main__30"/> father slept below in the cabin & I lay on <lb n="c57-0130__main__31"/> the deck looking at the stars & listening to <lb n="c57-0130__main__32"/> the dashing of the waves –I hailed the darkness <lb n="c57-0130__main__33"/> that shut Ireland from my sight &<lb n="c57-0130__main__34"/> my pulse beat with a feverish joy when <lb n="c57-0130__main__35"/> I reflected that I should soon see Geneva <lb n="c57-0130__main__36"/> The passed appeared to me <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>in the light of a fright<lb n="c57-0131__main__1"/>ful dream yet the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0131__main__d3e24588"/>place<del eID="c57-0131__main__d3e24588"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0131__main__d3e24591"/>vessel<del eID="c57-0131__main__d3e24591"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0131__main__d3e24598"/>in w<del eID="c57-0131__main__d3e24598"/> vessel in which <lb n="c57-0131__main__2"/> I was – <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0131__main__d3e24604"/>the sea &<del eID="c57-0131__main__d3e24604"/> the wind that blew me from <lb n="c57-0131__main__3"/> the detested shore of Ireland and the sea <lb n="c57-0131__main__4"/> which surrounded me told me too forci<lb n="c57-0131__main__5"/>bly that I was deceived by no vision & that <lb n="c57-0131__main__6"/> Cl<mdel>ai</mdel><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>erval my friend & dearest companion <lb n="c57-0131__main__7"/> had fallen a victim to me & the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0131__main__d3e24637"/>animal<del eID="c57-0131__main__d3e24637"/><lb n="c57-0131__main__8"/><lb n="c57-0131__left_margin__1"/>mo<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>nster of my creation.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0131__main__9"/> I repassed in my memory my whole <lb n="c57-0131__main__10"/> life; my quiet happiness when residing with <lb n="c57-0131__main__11"/> my family in Geneva –The death of my Mother <lb n="c57-0131__main__12"/> and my departure for Insgolstadt; I remem<lb n="c57-0131__main__13"/>bered with shuddering the mad enthusiasm <lb n="c57-0131__main__14"/> that hurried me on to the creation of <lb n="c57-0131__main__15"/> my hideous enemy & I called to my mind <lb n="c57-0131__main__16"/> the night on which he first lived. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0131__main__d3e24693"/>I un<del eID="c57-0131__main__d3e24693"/>I<lb n="c57-0131__main__17"/><lb n="c57-0131__left_margin__1"/>I was unable to <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0131__main__d3e24719"/>continue<del eID="c57-0131__main__d3e24719"/>pursue the train of thought –A <lb n="c57-0131__main__18"/> thousand feelings pressed upon me & I wept <lb n="c57-0131__main__19"/> bitterly.—<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0131__main__20"/> Ever since my recovery from the fever <lb n="c57-0131__main__21"/> I had been in the custom of taking every <lb n="c57-0131__main__22"/> night a small quantity of laudanum <lb n="c57-0131__main__23"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0131__main__d3e24741"/>a<del eID="c57-0131__main__d3e24741"/> for it was by means of this drug only <lb n="c57-0131__main__24"/> that I was enabled to gain the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0131__main__d3e24748"/>sleep<del eID="c57-0131__main__d3e24748"/>restnecessa<lb n="c57-0131__main__25"/>ry for the preservation of life. O<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0131__main__d3e24762"/>p<del eID="c57-0131__main__d3e24762"/>pressed <lb n="c57-0131__main__26"/> by the recollection of my various misfor<lb n="c57-0131__main__27"/>tunes I now took a double dose & soon <lb n="c57-0131__main__28"/> slept profoundly. But alas sleep did <lb n="c57-0131__main__29"/> not afford me <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0131__main__d3e24780"/>rest<del eID="c57-0131__main__d3e24780"/>respite from thought &<lb n="c57-0131__main__30"/> misery – my dreams <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0131__main__d3e24789"/>s<del eID="c57-0131__main__d3e24789"/>presented <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0131__main__d3e24793"/>to me<del eID="c57-0131__main__d3e24793"/><lb n="c57-0131__main__31"/> a thousand objects that scared me– <lb n="c57-0131__main__32"/> towards mor<mdel>d</mdel>ning I was <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0131__main__d3e24809"/>opp<del eID="c57-0131__main__d3e24809"/> possessed by <lb n="c57-0131__main__33"/> a kind of nightmare – I felt the fiends <lb n="c57-0131__main__34"/> grasp on my neck and could not free <lb n="c57-0131__main__35"/> myself from it—Groans & cries rung in my <lb n="c57-0131__main__36"/> ears– My father who was watching over me, <lb n="c57-0131__main__37"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0131__main__d3e24823"/>and<del eID="c57-0131__main__d3e24823"/> perceiving my restlessness <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0131__main__d3e24826"/>he<del eID="c57-0131__main__d3e24826"/> awoke me<lb n="c57-0132__main__1"/> and pointed <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0132__main__d3e24843"/>and pointed<del eID="c57-0132__main__d3e24843"/> to the port of <lb n="c57-0132__main__2"/> Holyhead which we were now entering.
